data.name: Five basic rules of drafting in fantasy football

data.message: don't draft any browns players
NEVER draft a WR on any team that has Alex Smith as their QB.
Last 2 seasons i drafted Peyton Manning 1st round and won both, last season i got a lot of help from Antonio Brown and Dez Bryant, so that rule about getting a RB in the first round is BS!!!!
Draft quarterbacks late, dawg. ALWAYS.

Draft dark horse running backs. Unless,  it's guys like ap or marshawn, rbs never live up to the fantasy preseason hype. Draft em, so you don't have to fight the waiver wire to get guys like forsett and bradshaw last year
Don't take any fantasy advice from field yates..
Best player available, No Raiders, No Browns, No Jets, No Redskins.
Never draft a seahawks player. #ninersempire

Mock draft the 1st, middle, and late round picks a couple of times, so you know when good players dry up in what areas.  This year after you miss on the top two QBs you can wait forever to grab your first QB.
Draft WRs  with capable QBs. Don't get rookies to start . No platoon  RBs. Don't draft this year's break out players. Only proven players.
Never draft a cowboys player! Not Romo, not Dez, not even Whitten.. I'll take backup Browns players before I draft a cowboy.
Don't draft a Jags, Raiders, Browns, or Titans player this year......under ANY circumstances.
Draft Peyton manning first round no matter who is available or where he is projected.
Always, always, ALWAYS draft two kickers in the first two rounds, then two defenses in the next two.
Don't draft running backs on bad teams
I draft favorites, and guys who haven't failed me in previous Fantasy seasons.
I want to be the last guy to draft a starting QB

1) Draft J. Nelson, A. Brown, and D. Thomas early as possible

2)Draft versitile and healthy RBS on balanced or pass happy teams with limited depth in the backfield (F. Gore, Anderson, L.Miller, Forsette)

3) TE are all the same after Gronk and Graham. Graham will fight with beast mode in the red zone (they'll tie) and Gronk may or may not put up 280 points. Don't waste the first or second round pick. 

4) Avoid Jets and Bills WRS. Avoid Pats RBS, Browns as a whole (except Gordon late) Avoid C.J. Spiller, V. Jackson, R. Bush, Megatron, R. White, and A. Ellington. Some are injury issues and some are unproductive, but they are tempting to take. 

5) Rothlisberger is a top 5 QB fantasy or otherwise. He is a 5th or 6th round steal. You can take 2 top flight WRS early sure up RB in the 3rd and 4th then....

data.name: What can you do to keep your fantasy football league interesting?

data.message: Our trophy to the winner each year is a custom nfl jersey of the winners favorite team with the year you win as the number and the teams name on the back!
My league is a 2 QB PPR league. It's definitely fun and more strategy for draft time. Gonna suggest the "empire pot"

We always draft at midnight following the last preseason game. Once you make a pick, you take a shot. It's a 2 team league 56 rounds. First one to die / gets rushed to the hospital forfeits their 1st round pick.

I am in a 6 Player Keeper League that is in it's 15 year of existence.. it started when we were teenagers & now we are in are 30s... being in a 6 player keeper league makes it Uber Competitive, our Draft technically starts in the 7th round & the Best Available Players are usually Rookies... Our Draft is ALWAYS Offline, One of our more competitive teams is a friend drafting via Skype from Kodiak Island in Alaska (the rest of us are currently located in Southern California) & besides our draft, the trading of players is vidal for future success.. for example, two years ago when Gronkowski was injured & Mike Vick was on Fire! I traded away a Hott Vick for an Injured Gronkowski.. Tagging Gronkowski as one of my keepers helped me win the Championship last season... my current "Keepers" heading into this upcoming season are:
RB: LeVeon Bell
RB: Eddie Lacy
WR: Julio Jones
WR: Kelvin Benjamin
WR: Larry Fitzgerald
TE: Rob Gronkowski

*our draft is set for the end of August

I have always built custom team pages hyperlinked through the league manager notes section.  It gives a more interesting web presence than the typical boring ESPN fantasy football league home pages used by 95% of leagues.  Here's an example: http://games.espn.go.com/ffl/leagueoffice?leagueId=161788&teamId=1&seasonId=2015
Auction keeper league with auction waiver wire and keepers for the following season. It stays interesting all year. Trust me
The winner of our league gets to choose one of the other 11's wife/gf and gets to sleep with them...it's awesome I won the league twice so far in 5 years!

20 team PPR dynasty league where you keep all 16 players plus have 3 additional spots for rookies that haven't been in a starting line up. Rookie draft every year with the worst team getting 1st overall every year but you can trade picks for players.

Mines a one player keeper league only start 8 players and get to do three formations qb rb rb wr wr te k def .qb rb wr wr wr te k def 
or qb rb wr wr wr wr k def
my keepers this year are russell wilson...marshawn lynch...odell beckham...calvin johnson ..we are allowed to keep 4 guts what you guys think not bad huh

We can trade players for draft picks the following year, we have 10 playing cards and we draw our draft picks and then redraw every two rounds so nobody gets stuck with the same pick and everyone gets a fair chance. You can also swap draft picks with someone during the draft (I'll give you my 8th pick for your 4th pick), blind auction bidding for free agents and my favorite is we have the option of putting in multiple offensive lineups. You must always start  1qb, 1te, 1 k and 1 d/sp. But then you can choose between a wishbone 3rb, 2 wr, a regular offense 2rb, 3wr, a run n shoot of 1rb, 4 wr or a 5 spread of 0rb, 5wr. It's a  ppr league

In our 2 franchise keeper ppr league, we curb tanking the season's end with 1 round dynasty rookie draft per finishing order of the season.  If you win the league, you get the first rookie pick; If you finish last, you get the last rookie pick.  The pick gets a 3 yr contract to your team that is void if you waive or trade them.  At the end of their contract, they are treated like all other rostered players, meaning, if you still want them on your team, you have to designate them as one of your 2 franchise keepers.  Example:  TeamA has Adrian Peterson and AJ Green(who just finished his 3 yr contract) designated as it's 2 franchise keepers.  TeamA also has, going into the 2015 rookie and roster drafts, two other players; Carlos Hyde(2014 rookie draft pick) and LeVeon Bell(2013 rookie draft pick).  TeamA finished the season as the runner-up and will draft 2nd in the 1 round rookie draft, but will draft 11th in the main roster draft(which is reverse order of finish to help create league parity).
My league is trying out drafting defensive players and punters instead of team defense and special teams.

To determine our draft order each team owner gets to select a team in the NBA draft lottery.  Owners select NBA teams based on their finish in our fantasy league the year prior. The order the lottery teams end up becomes our draft order. This method is designed such that the winner of the consolation bracket gets first choice of lottery teams (used to ensure the consolation bracket still is meaningful).  Additionally, the winner of the league receives naming rights for the team of the owner who finished in last place!

data.name: Fantasy Football Myth Busters: Are early-drafted rookies worth it?

data.message: ENOUGH TIME HAS BEEN WASTED! Get your entire fantasy league ranked at www.statchat.com and earn prizes and respect! Get proof to back up all that smack talk!

The Original Football Nerd

Fantasy Football 2015
Running Back Preview
I have always been a Running Back first type of Fantasy owner.Every year it seems to be more and more RB by committee situations and the rate of decline for RB's is greater than any other position. A RB can be the number 1 player one year and out the league the next. Ask MJD..When you can get a ball carrier in his prime with little competition for carries you need to jump on board with both feet.I have only identified 10 players that meet that criteria and these are the elite of the elite. In almost any scoring system imaginable I would go RB first if i can get one of the elites. There might be more safe players such as Andrew Luck or Antonio Brown but I would go Arian Foster or Jeremy Hill and then try to go WR later. It's much more manageable to try to juggle two lower tier QB's then try to find RB's later in the draft that or even worth a start .My 14 thru 19 ranked RB's are what I call "NO Mans Land" and will all go before I would really draft them. I don't hate them but don't see consistency.

I am sick and tired of hearing the parroted refrain of, "It's out of date the moment it's printed."  No kidding.  These magazines are for entertainment and that's exactly what they provide for me.  I pick up different FF magazines and enjoy reading the varied viewpoints of draft strategy, projections, etc.  Am I going to use this for my draft?  Of course not.  I create my own projections and subscribe to more than one FF site where I can get up-to-the-minute injury news and projections based upon my league rules.  Relax, people, and enjoy one of the greatest games ever put on this planet.  I'll read about FF in whatever form it's presented and am simply tired of pretentious "fans" who look down at the hard work presented by members of the industry we love.

I don't mind them making a magazine, but releasing it mid june with information that will be nearly 3 months old by the time the season starts doesn't do anybody any good.  It looks like they just want to be one of the first on the shelves to generate the most sales.

data.name: Fantasy Football: 10 players who could make or break seasons for fantasy owners

data.message: Landry and Matthews as a 3rd or 4th WR on my fantasy team

Stafford, Forsett, Matthews, and Yeldon maybe. Stafford now has a healthy Megatron. No reason why Forsett won't be the Feature Back again this year. So far it's been suggested that Yeldon will have a role like Forsett, and not a split backfield in Jax. Matthews should be the one to replace Maclin. 

As far as the other guys, I'm not confident about drafting them. The Lions backfield is a mess, so you can have Bell. Cooper is on the Raiders. Hyde was not impressive last year when he got the touches, and frankly why should I trust anyone on the 49ers in fantasy this year? Josh Hill != Jimmy Graham, although he could turn into a decent replacement, but I don't know. Andre Johnson is pretty old, and will be competing for targets with Hilton, Allen, and Fleener. Jarvis Landry isn't on a level above any other WR on the Dolphins, he's pretty much on par, although if a new WR1 were to emerge, it would likely be him, but I don't believe he's going to produce any game-changing points.

Just my opinion. Anyone could do great or poorly, but the first group are players I have more confidence in, and the second group have some big question marks still. Preseason will hopefully clear some things up.
